title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
summary: A novel set in the Jazz Age that tells the story of Jay Gatsby and his unrequited love for Daisy Buchanan.

author: George Orwell
summary: A dystopian novel about totalitarian surveillance, censorship, and the dangers of absolute political power.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
summary: A story about racial injustice and moral growth in the Deep South, told through the eyes of a young girl named Scout Finch.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
summary: Follows the life of Holden Caulfield, a teenager who struggles with alienation and identity in postwar America.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
summary: A romantic novel exploring manners, upbringing, morality, and marriage in 19th-century England.

title: Moby Dick
author: Herman Melville
summary: The quest of Captain Ahab to seek revenge on the giant white whale that bit off his leg.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
summary: A sweeping narrative about Russian society during the Napoleonic wars, blending history and fiction.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
summary: The adventure of Bilbo Baggins, who joins a group of dwarves to reclaim their mountain home from a dragon.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
summary: An epic fantasy trilogy about the quest to destroy the One Ring and defeat Sauron, the Dark Lord.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
summary: The first book in the Harry Potter series, introducing the young wizard and his adventures at Hogwarts.

title: The Da Vinci Code
author: Dan Brown
summary: A thriller combining art, history, and conspiracy as Robert Langdon uncovers secrets hidden by the Catholic Church.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
summary: A philosophical novel about a shepherd named Santiago who dreams of finding treasure in the pyramids of Egypt.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
summary: A dystopian story about a future society driven by technology, conditioning, and a loss of individuality.

title: The Kite Runner
author: Khaled Hosseini
summary: A story of friendship and betrayal in Afghanistan, exploring themes of guilt, redemption, and family ties.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
summary: The psychological journey of Raskolnikov, a man who commits murder and struggles with guilt and morality.

title: The Brothers Karamazov
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
summary: A philosophical drama about morality, free will, and faith, told through the lives of three brothers.

title: Anna Karenina
author: Leo Tolstoy
summary: The tragic love affair of Anna Karenina, set against the backdrop of Russian high society.

title: Les Misérables
author: Victor Hugo
summary: The story of Jean Valjean’s redemption and struggles in 19th-century France.

title: The Count of Monte Cristo
author: Alexandre Dumas
summary: A tale of betrayal, imprisonment, and ultimate revenge by Edmond Dantès.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
summary: The classic gothic horror novel introducing Count Dracula and the vampire myth.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
summary: The story of Victor Frankenstein, who creates a living being that spirals out of control.

title: Don Quixote
author: Miguel de Cervantes
summary: A comic tale about a nobleman who believes he is a knight and sets out on misguided adventures.

title: The Odyssey
author: Homer
summary: The epic journey of Odysseus as he attempts to return home after the Trojan War.

title: The Iliad
author: Homer
summary: The story of the Trojan War, focusing on the wrath of Achilles.

title: Meditations
author: Marcus Aurelius
summary: A collection of Stoic philosophy and personal reflections by the Roman emperor.

title: Republic
author: Plato
summary: A philosophical dialogue exploring justice, the ideal state, and the philosopher-king.

title: Nicomachean Ethics
author: Aristotle
summary: A treatise on ethics, virtue, and the path to the good life.

title: Thus Spoke Zarathustra
author: Friedrich Nietzsche
summary: A philosophical novel introducing ideas like the Übermensch and eternal recurrence.

title: Beyond Good and Evil
author: Friedrich Nietzsche
summary: A critique of traditional morality and philosophy, advancing Nietzsche’s radical views.

title: The Stranger
author: Albert Camus
summary: An existential novel about Meursault, a man who is detached from society and its norms.

title: The Plague
author: Albert Camus
summary: A novel exploring human resilience and solidarity during a deadly epidemic in Oran, Algeria.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel García Márquez
summary: A magical realist saga of the Buendía family in the fictional town of Macondo.

title: Love in the Time of Cholera
author: Gabriel García Márquez
summary: The story of enduring love between Fermina Daza and Florentino Ariza over decades.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
summary: A dystopian novel where books are banned and firemen burn any that are found.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
summary: A science fiction epic about politics, religion, and ecology on the desert planet Arrakis.

title: Foundation
author: Isaac Asimov
summary: A sci-fi series about the fall of a galactic empire and the science of psychohistory.

title: I, Robot
author: Isaac Asimov
summary: A collection of short stories exploring robotics and the Three Laws of Robotics.

title: Neuromancer
author: William Gibson
summary: The novel that pioneered cyberpunk, featuring artificial intelligence and cyberspace.

title: Snow Crash
author: Neal Stephenson
summary: A cyberpunk novel exploring the Metaverse, hacking, and a digital virus.

title: Cryptonomicon
author: Neal Stephenson
summary: A novel weaving together WWII codebreakers and modern cryptography entrepreneurs.

title: The Road
author: Cormac McCarthy
summary: A bleak post-apocalyptic journey of a father and son struggling to survive.

title: Blood Meridian
author: Cormac McCarthy
summary: A violent Western about the Glanton gang and themes of destiny and chaos.

title: Beloved
author: Toni Morrison
summary: A haunting novel about slavery, memory, and the supernatural presence of a dead child.

title: Song of Solomon
author: Toni Morrison
summary: A multigenerational story exploring African-American identity and folklore.

title: Invisible Man
author: Ralph Ellison
summary: A novel about race, identity, and invisibility in mid-20th-century America.

title: Native Son
author: Richard Wright
summary: The story of Bigger Thomas and systemic racism in Chicago during the 1930s.

title: Things Fall Apart
author: Chinua Achebe
summary: The story of Okonkwo, an Igbo leader, and the impact of colonialism in Nigeria.

title: Half of a Yellow Sun
author: Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie
summary: A novel about the Nigerian Civil War and the personal stories intertwined with it.

title: Americanah
author: Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie
summary: A story about love, identity, and migration between Nigeria, the UK, and the US.
